intro: Sisyrinchium cuspidatum var. arenarium, commonly known as sandleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. This variety is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
